result.execSummary:
The defendant Malisia A. Marek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate and follow through with any recommendations.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing
Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order
of C.O.

Defendant Malisia A. Marek in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea agreement put on the record.  Plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 2.  Court orders withheld sentence probation for two years with conditions of court costs; DNA surcharge and sample; AODA and follow through with any recommendations; letter of apology to victim due within 30 days and preapproved by probation; counseling as deemed appropriate. 32 days sentence credit.  Argument by counsel.   Bond revocation court orders $1,000.00 to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning May 1, 2016.  - rt

for Malisia Amo Marek

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant shall have no contact with C.B.O. - dob; 10-18-74.
Initial Appearance on 6-30-2015 at 1:00 p.m.
Arrest Report

District Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared in person.  Malisia A. Marek appeared in person, in custody. Malisia Marek is on a probation hold.   Attorney Tlusty requested a $2,000.00 signature bond; booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Defendant shall have no contact with C.B.O. - dob:  10-18-1974.  Court orders bond as requested by the district attorney.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Next court date is June 20, 2015.  - rt
